poem:
**The Committee**

In conference rooms of
stifled air, voices rise—
scattered fruit on plates  
of skepticism  
bruised by doubt.   
Where science meets  
uncertain hands,  
a shuffle of papers crumbles  
into shadowed discourse—  
What cost, a whisper, 
when confidence  
is left to wander  
among veils of unknowing?
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
